[{"id":"e2c46328-927a-4e1d-9fdf-241e121283e4","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: visit_With","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b63b964d-2c69-4403-8e88-31a452e5f222","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_With","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function processes Python's ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"with","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" statements, which are used for resource management (context managers). It analyzes the lifecycle of the context (entering and exiting) and, crucially, resolves the value assigned to any variable in the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"as ...","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" clause.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3cd64b39-1ae4-4ef8-896a-e3906ee72bca","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"In Python, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"with open("file.txt") as f:","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" involves hidden function calls. It calls ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"open()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__enter__()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" on the result, and finally ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__exit__()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" at the end. To understand that ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"f","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a file object, the analyzer must simulate this ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__enter__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" call. If it skipped this, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"f","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" would be an unknown variable, and any subsequent methods called on ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"f","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"read()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") would be unresolved.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"847cee22-7013-47e8-b766-58f3c53730f1","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it Creation:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It treats the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"with","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" block similarly to a loop or simulates "pushing" these methods onto the stack to acknowledge they are being Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Code:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"90c68ab0-e7fa-422f-8b7a-ecaeb5779dd1","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"class Manager:
    def __enter__(self):
        return 42
    def __exit__(self, *args):
        pass

with Manager() as num:

analyzes looks up integer).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a24f7d26-1d0d-4508-a21e-499ece3d53ce","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It assigns that return value (Integer) to the variable ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"num","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bd99490a-2a96-4ef1-a897-52f8487c1e85","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Inside
